column4: hello - whats an easy way to see what my USB drive is mapped to in /dev ?
ive plugged in my iomega rev drive, i can see it in lsusb but i dont know where to mount it from
it did not automount?
its not in my fstab
its not a pendrive, its a UDF file system removable hard drive thingy
this is the only removable drive currently connected to your PC?
yes, at the moment
try ls -la /dev|grep plugdev
how much output does that give for you?
zero
hrmm..
i wonder if im missing a kernel module
could be.
It didn't autodetect it at least, apparently.
btw, do you know how i can get and reload the kernel source?
Or it would have tried to mount it, most probably.
i come from gentoo land
recompile even
I haven't really ever done that, so I don't really know, but I am sure it's possible.
have a look at the Ubuntu wiki :-)
!wiki
those links might help :-)
